climbs.name: Livewire
climbs.fa: Terri Condon and Tony Sartin, July 24th, 2014

content.description: Livewire begins on very steep rock. A bouldery section traversing up and left leads to a vertical face and then a fun, overhung stretch on positive holds takes you to the anchor.
content.protection: 9 bolts to a two bolt, steel carabiner lower off.
content.location: Begin 10 feet left of Jagged Sky. Lower off with a 60 meter rope.

content.description: Steep and blocky climbing out the steep nose of rock.  Climb up and slightly left and then out the blocky bulges to a rest in a slight corner.  Finish up after you depump.  Classic.

All info herein is just basic information and placed here to tempt you to purchase the Guide Book: "Mammoth Area Rock Climbs" 3rd Edition by Marty Lewis and John Moynier. Please purchase the book for additional information and to provide money for future books. Steep blocky face. Lower off>

This is a left traversing line that sneaks under the steep rock and roofs found at the far right end of the cliff line. From the sixth bolt, climb straight up and over a bulge to a two bolt lower off. It’s best to have someone follow this route to clean draws.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a two bolt lower off
content.location: Start amongst a group of boulders a few feet left of Almost Famous and thirty feet right of Jagged Sky.

climbs.name: Almost Famous
climbs.fa: Dave Darnell, T. Sartin, A Meyer. Sept 1st, 2018

content.description: Steep little 5.10. Positive holds but a pump develops quickly.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a two bolt lower off at the top of the cliff.
content.location: 40’ right of Jagged Sky. First bolt is upside down in a small roof.
